entry.title: an enigmatic ancient site deep in Madagascar
entry.content: ... that an enigmatic ancient site deep in Madagascar (pictured) may have been built by Zoroastrians?

entry.title: Jacques Lewis
entry.content: ... that Jacques Lewis, a 105-year-old French veteran of D-Day, insisted that he participate in a ceremony commemorating the invasion's 80th anniversary?

entry.title: a memorial in Suffolk, England
entry.content: ... that a memorial in Suffolk, England, marks the deaths of six members of a scout troop in a 1914 boating accident and that of the sole survivor two years later in the Battle of the Somme?

entry.title: Ye Yanlan
entry.content: ... that, according to his family, Ye Yanlan was compelled to leave government service after speaking Cantonese in front of the emperor of China?

entry.title: Diaspora Revolt
entry.content: ... that the suppression of the Diaspora Revolt of 115–117 CE led to the near-total annihilation and displacement of Jewish communities in Cyrenaica, Cyprus, and much of Egypt?

entry.title: 50 Lan
entry.content: ... that 50 Lan occupied the number-one spot in Taiwan's bubble tea market for most of 2023?

entry.title: Irish Museum of Time
entry.content: ... that the world's oldest timepiece with an anchor escapement is in the collection of the Irish Museum of Time?

entry.title: disputes on Wikipedia
entry.content: ... that editors often line up in rival camps during contentious disputes on Wikipedia and the winning side typically cites encyclopedic policies to favor their viewpoint?

entry.title: Hugh O'Neill
entry.content: ... that although Hugh O'Neill publicly assisted the English Crown in thwarting Irish rebels during the Nine Years' War, he was secretly the leader of the Irish confederacy?
